page.title: 14ALL SAINTS CHURCH DATCHWORTH
page.content: This is the only active place of worship in the village. There was a Baptist Chapel but services ceased in 1970. The Church stands on one of the { {highest points in the County.}It was built by the Anglo-Saxons 810 years ago. It stands inside a moat which can still be seen today. It is a simple and dignified Church. It has a clock tower with a spire and a belfry which houses the six bells first hung in the 17th Century. The Rector is also the Rector of St Peter's in Tewin.Regular services are held on Sundays and during the week. There is a choir and a children's Sunday School group. These two C of E churches are in the Deanery of Stevenage, which like Woolmer Green is in the Diocese of St Albans.
